circumstances: Andrea Leach, known for frequent solitary walks, went missing after leaving her home at 33 Spittal Street. Andrea's sister recounted Andrea mentioning a plan to explore the swamps near Well Place, Dunblane, a location she often enjoyed. Concern grew among her family and friends when she did not return as expected. A friend, Nigel Johnson, attempted to reach her by phone but received no response. Inquiries revealed that Andrea had last been seen entering an old tunnel in the vicinity of 35 Kerse Road, Grangemouth, an area marked as dangerous due to its unstable structure. Andrea was later discovered by a concerned passerby who noticed her struggling near Kirk Entry. Emergency services confirmed her identity and aided her return home.

circumstances: Andrea Leach, a retired medical physicist, was last seen leaving her home at 33 Spittal Street. Known for her interest in exploring the outdoors with maps of the Highlands, Andrea had previously wandered off, adding to her loved ones’ concerns. A recent relationship breakdown may have contributed to her state of mind. A colleague reported she had been focused intensely on a specific area on her map, possibly linked to the swampland near West Murrayfield. Andrea did not show up and did not respond to calls. Concerned, Lynda informed the authorities. Investigations traced Andrea to a safe house located at Well Place, Dunblane. She was found disoriented but safe after reportedly becoming confused and inadvertently entering a tunnel complex en route to the cafe. Police believe disorientation due to her condition led her off course. Andrea was safely returned home after being located.
